TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WorkflowActivities extends Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ClientObject

Docs.summary: Contains methods that encapsulate Project Server workflow activities and methods, for use with version 4 of Windows Workflow Foundation (WF4).

remarks.para: Note: When you develop new Microsoft Project Server 2013 workflows, you can use Microsoft SharePoint Designer 2013, which internally accesses methods in the WorkflowActivities class of the CSOM.

The CSOM supports both online applications and on-premises applications for Project Server 2013. If you use Microsoft Visual Studio 2012 to develop workflows, when you drag a Project Server workflow activity to the design pane, the code directly uses the class in the CSOM. The CSOM then internally calls the class in the PSI WorkflowActivities service.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ClientResult<bool> ReadBooleanProperty (Guid projectId, string propertyId);

Public Function ReadBooleanProperty (projectId As Guid, propertyId As String) As ClientResult(Of Boolean)
public: Microsoft::SharePoint::Client::ClientResult<bool> ^ ReadBooleanProperty(Guid projectId, System::String ^ propertyId);
member this.ReadBooleanProperty : Guid * string -> Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ClientResult<bool>

Docs.param: The GUID of the property to read.
Docs.summary: Reads the value of the specified project property by using the SharePoint SPFieldType.Boolean type.
Docs.returns: The Boolean value of the property.

remarks.para: A Project Server workflow can call the ReadBooleanProperty method. Valid values can be retrieved from the collection by using the property. The ReadBooleanProperty method works only with fields where the property is SPFieldType.Boolean.

Docs.param: The GUID of the property to read.
Docs.summary: Reads the value of of the specified project property by using the SharePoint SPFieldType.Integer type.
Docs.returns: The Integer value of the property.

remarks.para: A Project Server workflow can call the ReadIntegerProperty method. Valid values can be retrieved from the collection by using the property. The ReadIntegerProperty method works only with fields where the property is SPFieldType.Integer.

Note: Reading an Optimizer Decision field fails if the Portfolio Analyzer has not finished with the project. To ensure that the project is committed before reading the value, you can set a Wait for Commit activity in the workflow.
For example, use the following REST query on a project that is not committed in Portfolio Analyzer (all on one line):
If the Optimizer Decision field is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), the query gives the following result:
remarks.code: PJClientCallableException: WorkflowActivityInvalidArgument WorkflowActivityInvalidArgument Error = Project property not found: propertyName = Optimizer Decision, mdPropUid = 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
